newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Ortiz reiterates peso free-floating.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Ortiz reiterates peso free-floating.

text.p: Finance Minister Guillermo Ortiz reiterated on Tuesday that Mexico has no exchange rate target and that its economic policies will not be changed before key mid-term elections in July this year.

"The monetary program is continuing as announced and as mentioned yesterday during my trip to the Yucatan, there will not be any manipulation of the exchange rate nor of fiscal policy," Ortiz told reporters at a trade conference.
Ortiz reiterated that the exchange rate is determined by the market.
"The government does not have an exchange rate target and it is the market that determines its level," he said.
